meanings.definition: A point on a route or path that marks a direction or location.
meanings.sent1: During our hike, we used the waypoints to guide us along the trail.
meanings.sent2: The pilot set the waypoints on the map to ensure a safe flight.
meanings.sent3: The waypoints on the treasure map led us to a surprise picnic instead of gold!
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a waypoint, guiding him through the ups and downs of life.
meanings.sent5: The lighthouse served as a bright and reliable waypoint for ships in the dark.

meanings.definition: A location or point used for navigation or as a reference point.
meanings.sent1: The ancient mariners relied on the stars as waypoints to navigate the seas.
meanings.sent2: The GPS system allows us to easily set and follow waypoints on our road trips.
meanings.sent3: The waypoints in the video game helped the character find hidden treasures.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, a joyful waypoint in the dull meeting.
meanings.sent5: The old oak tree served as a familiar and comforting waypoint in the vast forest.
